summary:
Google CEO Sundar Pichai updates on job cuts in town hall: 10% management roles cut and other changes

Publication Date: Not Specified | Source: Times of India

In a recent town hall meeting, Google CEO Sundar Pichai announced significant changes to the company's management structure, including a 10% reduction in management roles.

  • Pichai emphasized the need for efficiency and agility in the organization's structure.
  • The job cuts are part of a broader strategy to streamline operations and respond to market challenges.
  • Employees were informed about the criteria and processes for the reductions.
“We must remain focused on our priorities and adapt to a changing environment,” said Pichai.

International Gemmological Institute IPO share listing today: Stock debuts at 22% premium over issue price - CNBCTV18
summary:
International Gemmological Institute IPO share listing today: Stock debuts at 22% premium over issue price

Date: December 20, 2024 Source: Various News Outlets

The shares of the International Gemmological Institute (India) debuted on the exchanges with a premium of 22%.

The IPO was well-received, showcasing strong interest from investors and analysts alike.

  • Shares listed at ₹510 on NSE, compared to an upper price band of ₹417.
  • On BSE, shares listed at ₹504.85, indicating a 21% premium.
  • The IPO received a subscription of 35 times, reflecting robust demand.
  • Funds will be used to acquire IGI Belgium and IGI Netherlands, consolidating global operations.
  • IGI India holds a 50% market share in the Indian certification market.
“As the jewellery market expands, the demand for certifications will likely grow, driving IGI’s business further,” said analyst Palak Devadiga.

The IPO's performance indicates strong investor confidence in IGI, positioning it well for future growth within the global jewellery market.
newTitle: International Gemmological Institute IPO share listing today: Stock debuts at 22% premium over issue price

title: Infosys, TCS or Persistent Systems — These are the top Indian IT picks post Accenture results - CNBCTV18
summary:
Infosys, TCS or Persistent Systems — These are the top Indian IT picks post Accenture results

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Accenture has reported its fiscal Q1 results, showing a strong performance which positively affects Indian IT stocks.

  • Accenture's BFSI vertical grew by 10% sequentially, indicating strong performance.
  • Brokerage Jefferies identifies Infosys, TCS, and Coforge as top picks in the IT sector.
  • Accenture's positive results led to a 7% increase in its share price, influencing firms like Infosys and Wipro.
  • Citi remains positive on Infosys while having a neutral rating on HCLTech.
  • Despite cautious optimism, Indian IT firms face challenges with weak order book growth.
  • JM Financial lists Infosys, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra as favored large-cap stocks.
“The upgrade to Accenture's guidance was due to faster execution of deals won earlier, which augurs well for Indian IT companies.”

The performance of Accenture is seen as a leading indicator for Indian IT services, suggesting potential opportunities despite existing challenges.

summary:
Stocks To Watch: Airtel, Nestle India, Mazagon Dock, IndiGo, Exide, Hyundai

Date & Source: Not specified

Bharti Airtel Ltd., Nestle India Ltd., Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd., InterGlobe Aviation Ltd., Exide Industries Ltd., and Hyundai Motors India Ltd. are highlighted as key stocks to monitor before the trading session on Friday.

  • Bharti Airtel: Cleared Rs 3,626 crore specturm dues.
  • Nestle India: Suspension of most-favoured-nation status will have no impact on operations.
  • Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders: Commenced production for fast patrol vessels for the Indian Coast Guard.
  • InterGlobe Aviation: Approved a $43 million loan to a subsidiary.
  • Exide and Hyundai: Signed a term sheet for EV battery production.
  • Hindustan Construction Co: Raised Rs 600 crore through QIP.
  • Dhanlaxmi Bank: Approved rights issue of Rs 297.5 crore.
  • BASF India: Approved a demerger of its agricultural solutions business.
  • Kellton Tech Solutions: Approved raising Rs 100 crore through equity shares or securities.
  • GE Vernova T&D India: Received an order worth over Rs 400 crore.

Conclusion: Investors should watch these companies closely as they head into trading on Friday, especially given the significant activities noted.

Infosys, Wipro ADRs end with gains of up to 4% post Accenture results, can Indian IT replicate the move? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Infosys, Wipro ADRs end with gains of up to 4% post Accenture results, can Indian IT replicate the move?

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

The US-listed shares (ADRs) of Infosys and Wipro recorded gains of up to 4% after Accenture reported better-than-expected quarterly results and raised its annual guidance.

  • Infosys ADR rose by 3.4%, while Wipro ADR climbed by 2.3%.
  • Accenture's revenue for the first quarter exceeded analyst expectations, leading to a 7% rise in its shares.
  • The company raised its full-year revenue guidance to 4-7% from 3-6%.
  • The BFSI segment of Accenture reported a robust 10% growth sequentially.
  • GenAI bookings reached $1.2 billion, indicating a 20% quarter-on-quarter growth.
  • Despite strong performance, management noted a lack of recovery in client spending, especially in smaller deals.
“The results of Accenture puts the entire Indian IT basket into focus.”

In conclusion, the performance of Accenture may signal potential opportunities for Indian IT firms if they can replicate similar growth trends.
newTitle: Infosys and Wipro Shares Rise Post Accenture's Strong Results

title: Merchant network at the core of Fino’s small finance bank bid | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Merchant network at the core of Fino’s small finance bank bid

Publication Date: December 2023, Source: Live Mint

Fino Payments Bank is seeking to convert into a small finance bank, planning to utilize its extensive merchant network for lending and loan collection services.

  • Fino has about 1.8 million merchants providing financial services.
  • The proposal was made to the regulator for approval in December 2023.
  • Managing Director Rishi Gupta emphasized the potential of merchants as loan collection points.
“A significant portion of these merchants can be used to collect loan repayments.” - Rishi Gupta

This proposal marks a strategic move by Fino Payments Bank to expand its customer base while leveraging existing resources effectively.
newTitle: Fino Payments Bank Leverages Merchant Network for Small Finance Bank Proposal

Bitcoin (BTC) Dips Below $98K, Ethereum's ETH, Cardano's ADA, Dogecoin Tumbled Over 10% in Crypto Correction - CoinDesk
summary:
Bitcoin Dips Below $96K While CoinDesk 20 Plunges 10% Amid Fed-Spurred Rout; SOL Surrenders Post-Election Rally

Date: Dec 19, 2024, Source: CoinDesk

The cryptocurrency market faced a significant downturn on December 19, with Bitcoin dropping below $96,000 amidst a wider market selloff driven by Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments regarding interest rates. The correction saw Bitcoin dipping 4.8% in 24 hours, with altcoins like Ethereum and Cardano also experiencing considerable losses of over 10%.

  • Bitcoin's price traded around $98,000 before falling below $96,000.
  • The CoinDesk 20 Index dropped over 10% during this period.
  • Nearly $1.2 billion in leveraged crypto derivatives positions were liquidated.
  • Traditional markets also reacted, with slight gains that eroded during trading.
  • Experts suggest this pullback may be healthy following the substantial rise in prices.
"The crypto market has already been on pins and needles around the possibility for a correction following the record run in the price of bitcoin through $100,000," said Joel Kruger, market strategist at LMAX Group.

This market correction highlights the volatility inherent in the cryptocurrency space and the influence of external economic factors, such as decisions made by the Federal Reserve.
newTitle: Bitcoin Dips Below $96K as Crypto Market Faces Major Correction

title: Rupee breaches 85/$ for 1st time on Fed's comment of fewer rate cuts in future - The Times of India
summary:
Rupee breaches 85/$ for 1st time on Fed's comment of fewer rate cuts in future

Date & Source: October 2023, Times of India

The Indian Rupee has crossed the 85 mark against the US dollar for the first time, triggering concerns among economists following comments from the Federal Reserve regarding fewer rate cuts in the future.

  • The Indian Rupee has depreciated due to inflationary pressures and economic uncertainties.
  • Federal Reserve hints at maintaining higher interest rates for an extended period.
  • The movement in the forex market reflects investor sentiment and market volatility.
"The rupee's performance is a direct consequence of external financial policies that directly impact Indian economic stability." - Market Analyst

This development could have significant implications for India's trade balance and inflation rates, necessitating close observation from policymakers.
newTitle: Rupee Breaches 85/$ Amid Federal Reserve's Rate Cut Comments

title: Ola Electric store count to touch 4,000 this Christmas; CEO Bhavish Aggarwal eyes presence in 'every town, city, tehsil' | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Ola Electric store count to touch 4,000 this Christmas; CEO Bhavish Aggarwal eyes presence in ’every town, city, tehsil’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Ola Electric aims to significantly increase its store presence to 4,000 by Christmas, with CEO Bhavish Aggarwal highlighting the affordability of electric vehicles.

  • Ola Electric anticipates reaching 4,000 stores by Christmas.
  • Customers can save around ₹4,000 per month by using Ola's electric vehicles.
  • New electric bike models were released on Independence Day in 2024: Roadster Pro, Roadster, and Roadster X.
  • Ola aims to integrate its own batteries into vehicles starting in the first quarter of the next financial year.
  • Ola's first electric scooter, the S1 Pro, was delivered in December 2021.
“With EVs, you will save ₹4,000 per month. Your savings will increase, and you'll save money with this savings wala scooter,” - Bhavish Aggarwal

Ola Electric’s expansion plans reflect its commitment to increasing accessibility to electric vehicles across various regions.
newTitle: Ola Electric Expands Store Count to 4,000 by Christmas

title: Accenture ushers in holiday season with $1.2 billion in Gen AI orders | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Accenture ushers in holiday season with $1.2 billion in Gen AI orders

Publication Date: December 5, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Accenture Plc announced its generative AI bookings reached $1.2 billion for the quarter ending November 2024, indicating significant growth in client spending on new technology despite ongoing economic pressures.

  1. Accenture secured $1.2 billion in Gen AI bookings for the quarter, totaling $4.2 billion since September 2023.
  2. The company added 24,000 employees, primarily in India, reflecting business momentum.
  3. Julie Sweet, CEO, noted companies are prioritizing Gen AI spending within current budgets.
  4. Accenture's Gen AI bookings represented 6.4% of overall order bookings for the quarter.
  5. The overall revenue for the first quarter was reported at $17.69 billion, a rise of 7.8% sequentially.
“Right now, it still generally feels more like a prioritization within current budgets,” said Julie Sweet.

Despite strong Gen AI performance, Accenture remains cautious about macroeconomic conditions, suggesting potential challenges for future growth.
newTitle: Accenture Secures $1.2 Billion in Generative AI Orders, Signals Growth Amid Challenges

title: Big push to Atmanirbhar Bharat! Hyundai Motor India’s major partnership with Amara Raja - ET Now
summary:
Hyundai Motor India Partners with Amara Raja for Indigenous AGM Batteries

Updated Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: ET Now News

Hyundai Motor India Limited (HMIL) has entered a significant partnership with Amara Raja Energy & Mobility Limited (ARE&M) to incorporate indigenously manufactured AGM (Absorbent Glass Mat) battery technology in its vehicles, signifying a crucial step towards localization in line with the ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ initiative.

  • The Made-in-India AMARON AGM batteries have outperformed conventional CMF batteries by about 150% in real-world durability tests.
  • AGM batteries are suitable for Indian driving conditions due to their wider operational temperature and longevity.
  • They offer quick charging, minimal maintenance, and high power efficiency for vehicles with ISG systems.
“At Hyundai Motor India Limited, adopting innovative technology to exceed the ever-evolving customer expectations has been our forte.” - Gopalakrishnan Chathapuram Sivaramakrishnan, HMIL

This partnership is expected to enhance HMIL’s product offerings while promoting local job creation and supporting the Indian economy.
newTitle: Hyundai Motor India Partners with Amara Raja for Indigenous AGM Batteries
